dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4026 IH: Pala Band of Mission Indians Land Transfer Act of 2017
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Vargas (for himself and Mr. Cook) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To take certain land located in San Diego County, California, into trust for the benefit of the Pala Band of Mission Indians, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Pala Band of Mission Indians Land Transfer Act of 2017.

section.header: Transfer of land in trust for the Pala Band of Mission Indians

paragraph.text: If, not later than ___ days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Tribe transfers title to the land described in subsection (b) to the United States, the Secretary shall take that land into trust for the benefit of the Tribe.

The land transferred under paragraph (1) shall be part of the Pala Indian Reservation and administered in accordance with the laws and regulations generally applicable to land held in trust by the United States for an Indian tribe.

subsection.text: The land referred to in subsection (a)(1) is the approximately 700 acres of land located in San Diego County, California, and generally described as ____ on the map titled ______ and dated _______.

paragraph.text: enlarge, impair, or otherwise affect any right or claim of the Tribe to any land or interest in land that is in existence before the date of the enactment of this Act;
affect any water right of the Tribe in existence before the date of the enactment of this Act; or
terminate or limit any access in any way to any right-of-way or right-of-use issued, granted, or permitted before the date of the enactment of this Act.

subsection.text: The Tribe may not conduct, on the land taken into trust for the Tribe pursuant to this Act, gaming activities—

paragraph.text: as a matter of claimed inherent authority; or
under any Federal law, including the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act (25 U.S.C. 2701 et seq.) and regulations promulgated by the Secretary or the National Indian Gaming Commission under that Act.

subsection.text: For the purposes of this section:

paragraph.text: The term Secretary means the Secretary of the Interior.
The term Tribe means the Pala Band of Mission Indians.
